lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you so much Loot Crate. I think we announced the new theme for this month's loot crate last week, but Sam, if you would like to give us a couple of words on our sponsor, please.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am running out of things to say. So instead, I composed a little song, and I thought that Miss Ashley Johnson could help me with it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to sing a couple of lines, and it will be very apparent what the rhyming word is, and you chime in with that. Little known fact, Ashley Johnson, beautiful singing voice, she's a soprano.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I am! Yes, and?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here's a song for Loot Crate. Okay. Ashley, I need you to focus here. It's to the tune of the Beverly Hillbillies. (singing) Well, yeehaw for nerd swag, let's all give a big hoot. You get a pretty crate and they fill it with--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Loot!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Very good! (singing) With gear and apparel that'll make you look real cute. You'll even be attractive when your butt makes a--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Toot!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Very good. (singing) Subscribe with the link that pops up on your computer. With the dough that you saved, buy some hot wings at--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hooters!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Very good. (singing) You'll be all hot and bothered even if you're spayed or neutered. So pull down your skirt, and stick that loot in your--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Cooter!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! It's in your crate. You put your loot in your crate.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jesus!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's really inappropriate.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Jesus, why would you stick it in your cooter?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It made all the sense.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Holy shit! Loot in a Loot Crate. Good God! Anyway, magic everyone. Sign up and use the exclusive promo code-- Wait a second, there's a new promo code?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's new, yeah. Five dollars off Loot Crate and Loot Crate DX if you use promo code CHAOTICGOOD. All caps, one word.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go check it out guys. I'm done.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sam Riegel, you are against the law.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The code is only good for 48 hours.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, is that true?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It is true. 48 hours only.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I should read these before I do the ads.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: CHAOTICGOOD!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam; I appreciate it. Ashley, you really need to clean that mouth.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You know, there is only one place to put loot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Really, keep it in your crate, guys, highly recommended.

lines.name: TALIESIN, LAURA, ASHLEY
lines.text: Keep it in your crate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: #keepitinyourcrate. So yes. Thank you Loot Crate for being our awesome sponsor. Other announcements: BlizzCon this weekend! For those who are going to be there, a number of us are going to be there. There are panels Friday. Who is going to be there Friday?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Friday! There.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. Me and Liam will be there Friday. A number of other of us will be wandering the halls.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will be in the bathrooms.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just hanging out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just chilling. Just looking to massage folks as they come in? Taking tips?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ask if they need their hands dried.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And let us know what you think. Also, Marisha, if you want to talk about the new Spotify playlists that we have coming up here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah! We did those awesome playlists like a year ago, and if you didn't know, by the way, we did playlists about a year ago, each one of us, for our characters. You should go and check them out. They are deep somewhere in the Geek and Sundry website.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Our Spotify playlists.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dude, they were so good!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They were really good!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And they give really good background into our characters.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, they actually give a lot of insight, if you pay attention. So yeah! Go look at our playlists, because we are going to be doing a round two, starting next week. Because it has been like 50 some odd episodes, and a lot of shit has happened.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (braying)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What animal was that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You wish you knew. Check out the playlist to find out!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Grog impersonation) This is me when I'm sad. This is me when I'm happy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He found a tape recorder.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Starting next week, we will have info available on the Geek & Sundry website and our Twitter, as soon as that becomes available. Anything else that anyone wants to announce? So glad you could be here with us this week, Ashley! (cheering)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we going to do this thing at the break? Is that happening? What are we going to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So our critical costumes contest. We are announcing the winners after the break!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: After we choose them on the break.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we have all been looking at them. We all have our personals, but now we have to fight amongst ourselves and duke it out for the winner.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We need to fight. We are having a real battle.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We have Nerf Guns.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And Jello.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And sticks!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You brought Jello?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is going to be fantastic. For the record: You guys are ridiculous!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They are amazing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those costume entries, every single one was amazing!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cats.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There were cats in costume!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Victor cat!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I can't even.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Scanlan cat.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can we do one with just animals, sometime? Like during the Westminster Dog Show?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just cats! Critical Cats!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Critter Critters!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have already lost control. This has already gone. We are over it. We have peaked. We are done.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Also Talks. Talks Machina will be live every Tuesday at 7:00pm on Alpha. Every week, there will be like two to three of us on there, answering questions, giving insight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When does it start?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: November...

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: 15th!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It will be on there, and you can find out all of the juicy details, who Grog is really in love with. And you can follow @talksmachina on (shouts) Twitter! There are so many cool things! There will be gift giveaways and all sorts of stuff.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Travis! It's exciting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's going to be fun. We are going to haze Brian Foster every single week.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh no, he hazes us, man.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, it was kind of intense.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's an OG D&D player, though, right? Like decades of Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, he's old school. He's old school.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Always checking me in my rolls, on my choices in the game.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's off-camera laughing at us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who I talk to on any given afternoon. It is all I hear about. I'll do what I want, Brian! It's D&D!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you can look forward to more of that on Talks Machina.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: D&D: there's no wrong way to play except our way.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed. Well then, on that note, let's go and bring us onto the happy day-glo lives of Vox Machina right now, and Exandria, as we step into tonight's episode of Critical Role

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sparkle, sparkle, sparkle, friendship! [dramatic music]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Liam.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Welcome!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that was where we last left off. As you finish your conversation with the rest of your current temporary council on the ziggurat beneath Whitestone, you've made the choice of Fort Daxio as being your next grounds of conflict. What do you wish to do? (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if we get an airship, and put the ziggurat inside of it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay!

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: What?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have an idea! (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should go to Fort Daxio then. And talk to them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did we need to send word to all of our allies that that is where we are going? Has that been done already?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel we need to scout the location first?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's scout first, let's head there and then if everything seems copacetic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do we get there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: By airship!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: By the fabulous Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let me scry, then we will bamf through a tree. Sound good?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you scry here though? We are by the Orb of Death.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we have to go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hold on! Let me go get Pike.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got her, guys! She's here!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey! Oh man!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, Pike. Good to see you. High five!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow! We almost left without her.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, so he said we were going to Fort Daxio?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. We are totally going to Fort Daxio.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay! That sounds--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's where we are going to amass our forces. Potentially.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think it is a great idea. On our walk, we talked about it, and I think that it is a really good idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Monstah has spoken.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Now it's unanimous.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, can she scry? Do you need to scry? Do we have scrying things?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can scry. Yeah. I got my Scry Ball.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who are you scrying?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am-- Do we know someone in Fort Daxio?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We do! We do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Because your--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My shit father?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, your shit father.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, he knew somebody there, but I don't remember who it was.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, shit. Hold on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But wait! Anyone from like when we were with the 'fugees? The refugee camp? Didn't some of them go to Daxio?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Oh! What about that guy that was running the refugee camp? The leader! Bernard, or Reginald, or--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, Reginald is dead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not Reginald.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Most of our friends are dead, let's be fair.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we have met a lot of dead people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was his name? Bernard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who are you referring to?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The guy who was running the refugee camp that was like a blacksmith, not a blacksmith, but he had stepped up to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait! Rothfuss?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. I know who you're talking about.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. We found his brother? His son?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When we left the orc camp, and we headed out into the snow--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was close to when we found Tyriok without an arm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They were heading to Fort Daxio, weren't they?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I don't recall if they were heading to Fort Daxio.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This was after the goliaths?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is the part of the show where we look through our notes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's D&D! It is a Dungeons & Dragons game.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You guys actually write notes? I just draw pictures.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They write notes. I draw pictures.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I listen to them read their notes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, good.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I look over her shoulder and read her notes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, they're empty right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mine are terrible! Arbiter Brom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Spireling Shenn?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Orc skull?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you know who I'm talking about. Yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This will be Cornelius. Maybe? I'm trying to--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow!

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA
lines.text: Cornelius.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: These are people who were in Daxio, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, these are people who were sent to Kymal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shit balls! Master Quall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also Kymal. Or Westruun. One of the two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we not know anybody at Fort Daxio?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No one that you know of. Fort Daxio--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is Allura still here? Is Allura still around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Allura is still around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Allura, do you know anyone in Fort Daxio?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunately, the one member I know is the Warmaster, Mikael Daxio, the father of Riskel. But "as far as I know, he is currently sealed off in Syngorn with the rest of the army."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right. Shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, hang on, wait. Is Fort Daxio near Syngorn?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. The army, remember, part of the army got sent to Syngorn, and then Syngorn bamfed away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Three of the regiments in Fort Daxio were sent to Syngorn, with the supposed dragon incursion in the Stormcrest Mountains. Most of them went with Syngorn when it got pulled back to the Feywild, and one regiment still remains at Fort Daxio. Fort Daxio is north of Emon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there any guards from Emon here? Because the guards were also the guards from Emon went to Syngorn. So maybe someone in one of the guards knows one of the guards in Fort Daxio.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is a lot of work.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Is there an easier way to go about this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could ask around?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am going to go and see if I can find one of the Whitestone guards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't do this a whole lot. Yeah, 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You spend the next 30 minutes asking around for various guards, and the few that you do know that are from Emon are like, "I don't really know anyone from Daxio. It's very regimented. I "wasn't interested in the military, I wanted to more sit around the city and get paid to wear armor."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So they're more militant? Or like, the army?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It is where the military is, yeah."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You don't have any army friends? Are there any army friends here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I think there are a few here that at least might know that, but I am not one of them. Sorry."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where? Where? Point me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (shouting) I don't know! That way!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (shouting) All right! I go that way!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth spends the better part of the next hour or so without luck, unable to really find anyone to match the description from before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Guys, this sucks! We don't know anyone in Daxio!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we just fucking go there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is like when you're on a level in a video game, and you run around and around and around. You can't find that thing that triggers to the next section of the video game.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, Gilmore knows everybody. He must know someone in Daxio.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know if he knows army people.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, he knows a lot of people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. If Gilmore doesn't know anybody, then we are going to the nearest location, and then we're hoofing it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kraghammer is near-ish.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, let's go talk to Gilmore.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As the rest of your council has essentially scattered throughout Whitestone Castle since your meeting, Gilmore is easy to find, beginning to make his way out of the castle down towards his homestead, and prepare what he has for the coming struggle. So as you intercept him walking down the outside, he says: "Oh, hi! I'm sorry. What did you need?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know anyone in Fort Daxio? Please say yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles, sighs) "You know, I believe I have had a couple of people come through my "establishment."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that what they call it? "Come through my establishment?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, that is exactly what they call it when you have an establishment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is actually exactly what they call it, Grog."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, we don't necessarily need to know anybody if you happen to know a very fast way to get to Daxio.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I mean, there are magics that can get a person there quickly, but--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there trees? Are there lots of trees? It's grassland.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shaun, could you send one of us there? Is that possible by any chance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let me think."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One? Why one?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because if one of us goes with the Gatestone, Keyleth can jump over, she can see trees there, she can tree her way back here. I mean, I don't know; I'm spitballing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It seems like a really long process--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, all right. Where's your great idea?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, one of us goes there, finds a tree and then bamfs back, and Keyleth brings us all over--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, Keyleth can scry on you once you're there, and see the tree.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fabulous. Send one of us over there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He says: "Well, I can't. But Allura might be able to help with that. Ask her?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. Back to Allura.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (sings Yakety Sax)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Chickens with our heads cut off, eh?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In and out of the doors.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like a Monty Python animation. Back and forth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Trip three times.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly. Apparently, Gilmore doesn't seem to have access to the type of translocation magic you're asking about.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You eventually find your way to Allura in Whitestone Castle, who is currently having a conversation with Cassandra. She turns back to you, and as you ask the same question, she responds with a: "I actually do have prepared-- I can bring up to eight other individuals with me."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! How perfect!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, wait. One... Somebody else do this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're good.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think we're okay. It's just right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you fine doing that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. I can only go there, so we have to have some way of returning, which I believe you "can handle that. All right?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can get us back, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Then whenever you are ready, I suppose."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now's as good a time as any. Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, gather round." She puts her arms out and gestures for you to reach in like a hand circle.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Come on Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we taking Kima?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kima! Can we take Kima?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we want to take Kima?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course! I have to go get her"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One too many though, isn't it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. This is perfect.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I swore she said eight. Or eight along with her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Eight along with me."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're just reconning.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it's fine. Let's just go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why don't we flip that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Just don't tell her. She gets a bit testy when she's not included. All right, very well." She takes your hands. Some of you close your eyes, some of you don't. That familiar rush of warmth underneath your stomach begins fill--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (fart noise)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your vision goes white, and as it slowly adjusts to the daylight, this light breeze soothing you, you look around and see yourselves now standing in the Othendin Pass, which is this large rocky ravine that rides up on each side of you to these tall, cliff side edges of the very very southwest side of the Cliffkeep Mountains. This is far north of Emon. While you see the ground itself is very cracked land, you can see dry and long dead bushes, you can see bits and pieces of dead trees that have for a long time been petrified, broken over or been left without much of an actual fertile ground to exist in. You glance off to the eastern side of your direction, and you can see a very large cluster of reddish-brown trees; a forest there that has long died, or at least is definitely in the fall season type of color change. But the vegetation around here is very sparse, very scrub and in some cases very dry and dead. You do see to the immediate northwest of your current location, clinging to the side of the mountain cliff, what you assume is Fort Daxio: a massive stronghold, built of gray and brown stone, an outer wall perimeter that completely surrounds it, buttressed against each side of the cliff, and within, you can see a multi-tiered fortress structure within, built specifically for defending against any sort of army siege or incursion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, that is way bigger than I expected it to be.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's what I'm talking about.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I check the skies? Anything flying around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey! This will go well. Three!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to look up, and you see a small bird, and it's really small and it'ss really cute, and your eyes watch it, and you watch it fling off that way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (gasp) Pike!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh lookit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's a little--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's tiny right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's so cute.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, he chirps I bet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can you make thorbilly land on your finger like a Disney princess?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I? This is so dumb. Yeah, I'm going to try.

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: Animal handling check!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I was going to say. Make an animal handling check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow! Have we ever rolled this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One! We have done one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have done one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One. I don't remember why, or who did it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my God, you've got really good animal handling!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, all right!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And you rolled a dick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it a dick?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It 's a four. Okay, nine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's kind of a dick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Into the sky.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It was a baby thorbilly. They're a little more shy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's all right. Next time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like anybody's in the fort looking down at us? Are we far enough away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check. You're a few hundred yards away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fucking shit balls. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16. Okay. Best you can tell, you do see some shapes along the top of the outer battlements; the wall that surrounds the structure. However, from this distance, you're not sure if they have seen you yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Best you can tell, it's shit-balls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's shit-balls up there. Just lots of shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's a shit-ball?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, if we walk up to the fort, what's our cover story?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No cover story. We tell them who we are and what we're doing here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're dragon fighters bringing the fight to their town?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're not bringing the fight here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We are looking to fight here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit, we are. That's the plan, that's my plan

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's not a town. It's--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a fort.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, whatever it is, I don't think we should tell them that we're dragon fighters bringing the fight to their fort.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whose fort is this?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Daxio's, who's in Syngorn. No, it is!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, that is the warmaster, who has been assigned by Emon. This is technically where the majority of the military of Emon is stationed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So this is Emon's military? Not Syngorn's.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, this is Emon's military.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And we have got Allura with us; she's on the council.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And they are at war as well.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is already going well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're protecting the world.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Super good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, yeah. If this is for Emon, then it's for Emon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is specifically where you want things to attack, as opposed to towns.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But they might be skittish, so we should probably have a little protection as we go up there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have any idea on who we're talking to?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dudes. I think their commanding officers are in Syngorn. For the most part.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we need a white flag as we approach?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want to hold up Pike, as we walk closer?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can whip my hair.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (singing) I whip my hair back and forth. I whip my hair back and forth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys begin to approach the outside of Fort Daxio, you can see a number of the figures on the wall beginning to move faster and gathering at edges. You can see one of a few defensive ballistae being locked in. Allura begins stepping into the front, and she puts her hand out and says: "Don't "worry, let me do the talking for this."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (air horn)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (air horn)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, man!

lines.name: MATT, SAM
lines.text: (air horn)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because I am not a war horn.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (kazoo)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (deep and cool horn)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Of all the sounds you could make!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fort Daxio is very sparsely run right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All their horns were broken in the war.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They left the regiment behind with a small conch shell that is partially broken.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Piggy's got the conch.

lines.name: LAURA, ASHLEY
lines.text: (pathetic horn noise)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did we just find your Achilles Heel?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Horn noises?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Man of a thousand voices: animals, creatures-- can't do horns.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And no horns.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go! To make you happy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't do horns; they sicken me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She puts her hands down. "Very well, walk with me."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They didn't even check us out; just letting us in. Be on your guard. They're too trusting.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys approach the gates and begin to walk through, you can see there is about 15 guards stationed above the top that all have cocked crossbows, that are trained on you guys--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Never mind!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Any word from Mikael? Any word from the rest of the regiments?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're in Syngorn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Still? In Syngorn?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As far as we know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. My apologies. I am General Elle Gorgofon."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Elle Gorgofon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Elle Gorgofon. I am the commander of the Aegis Regiment and I welcome you, for the time "being, to Fort Daxio. Follow me." She turns on her heel and begins to march at a very brisk pace back towards the stronghold itself. The other soldiers turning around as well. Allura gives you all a head nudge to follow suit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay! Yeah! Let's go. This is going great. We haven't even done anything wrong yet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Give us time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're walking around, Keyleth, Vex, and Vax, looking over the number of soldiers that are here, you have roughly 20 or so you see on the top of the wall, maybe 25 to 30 that occasionally are stepping around the base of it or the interior of this main courtyard. For the entirety of the army of Emon, the regiment that's here, doesn't seem to be very busy or very well--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Stocked?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This regiment is not extremely large. It looks like this may be the defensive regiment that was left behind to guard the fort, when other regiments are sent out on whatever duties.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You said we saw 40?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 50 people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 40 to 50 soldiers on the outskirts of the stronghold. You don't know how many are inside necessarily.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's like the Alamo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fairly lightly guarded right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Which ended well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It depends on who you ask, really.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys enter the stronghold, it's beautiful in its construction. It also looks like it's been in some level of disrepair. It's definitely built for function. The furniture and decor on the interior is very simple, very pragmatic. It is made for function more than presentation. You're led through two small hallways to the right to one central chamber where there are a series of benches and chairs, whatever has been assembled to the area and pulled to the center area. It would be considered a conversation room or war room in some circumstances, but it's very haphazardly thrown together. You also do notice that there are a couple of rooms that have a foul stench, and as you glance off to the left into the inside, you can see there are piles of folded dark material.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's your favored terrain. But you guys are led into this main chamber.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we just pass by those things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you begin to walk by, you glance over and see it as you go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we see what it is? It looks like dark folded material?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to stop and look behind, you can have a closer look. It's a hide-type material. It looks folded, and then as you walk in, you can see it's actually a series of piled corpses of some sort of leathery creature or creatures that have been pushed into an area there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take this moment to change out my attunement for my gloves from my sword. I'm going to put my gloves on and unattune to my sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: General, how many soldiers does this fort support?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she enters the chamber ahead of you and turns around and sits in her chair, her shield set to the side. "We currently now, as the Aegis Regiment, have a grand total of 225 soldiers."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pretty good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And how many can be here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As far as all the regiments?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We're looking at, between how many survive or return from Syngorn, close to 2,000."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (quietly) All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So you have 225 here currently?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We do."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And how is morale? Everyone have enough supplies and ready to defend the fort if needed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "To be perfectly honest--" And the door closes behind you as two of the guards step in front and watch it as you all find your seats or at least stand in the space. General Elle goes, "To be perfectly honest, we are very low on supplies. Any of the trade routes to and from "Kraghammer have been constantly harried by wyvern riders. We've had to defend our location a couple "times by some errant wandering sentinel wyvern riders. It's been-- (sighs) We're on the edge of "starvation."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit. Pardon my bluntness, but any flybys by Thordak himself?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So seeing some seemingly friendly faces--" And she nods towards Allura, "--is the best news I've had in a very long time."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In your Warmaster's defense, it might be beyond his control to get back here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Things are dire.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thordak is changing the entire landscape to be very similar to the Fire Plane.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And he's stuck in the Feywild.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Who's stuck in the Feywild?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Warmaster, here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Mikael?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, Mikael.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All of Syngorn, actually.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we telling them this?

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Why not?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, at least I know that they weren't wiped out, and that's good news. But still, we're "not enough to even attempt an incursion on Emon by our own."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, that is true, and that is the purpose for our visit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We may be able to help, though. At least where resources are concerned.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I would say so. We have to. That will be job one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How is the land around the fort? Do you have any farm land currently?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What little bit grows here is not of the edible variety. We have to rely on the farmlands "of Emon for most of our produce, and those have dried up, so we've been left to hunting and "slaughtering what is available, which is not much these days, as we're constantly in battle with the "giants of the north to keep some semblance of food intake to keep our soldiers fed and living."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (quietly) We can help a little with that, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yes. And we'll have to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe throw some food through a tree when we open it up, just chuck some corn.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sandwiches!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Take some spaghetti!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Could we load up a cart, though, and wheel it through?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, but can't Keyleth make some farmland, right here in the fort? Little small garden sort of a thing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It takes eight hours, but it seems like we might have to do some field trips anyway.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can load it with supplies as well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To here. Everything will be coming here, if things go the way that we hope they will.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: General, can I ask, are you close with Mikael?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've been under him for 15 years, yes."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Consider yourself friends?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Friends?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're the worst.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, it didn't even take a second. Not one second. Have you no decency?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I specifically looked left, hoping.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (clears throat)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry. You've been under him for how long?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "15 years."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 15 years. Long time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pick a fight. Pick a fight with the general, then. Good. That's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Give them your respect. They've proven time and "time again to be capable."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Forgive us, we've just been through a lot, Elle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've actually already killed three of the five Chroma Conclave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She leans back in her chair. "Is this true?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I reach in and I pull out one of the teeth and throw it on the table.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can't just keep giving those away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She catches it in the middle. She gives you a very stern look, and eyeing you over, trying to give you a read and then slowly it goes from group to group. "Well, then perhaps this is our "salvation." Throws the tooth back to you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you see that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was a good catch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, guys.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Before we get ahead of ourselves, our hope is that we think we can lure Thordak out of the city, and we think we can get him into a piece of terrain that gives us the advantage. We were hoping this would be where we consolidate our forces and make a stand against him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You wish to bring the Cinder King here?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not just the Cinder King. We would also bring allies to support you and to buffer your forces and hopefully with enough planning time to get you and your men back on their feet, well fed and ready for a fight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're hoping we'll be able to bring Mikael and Syngorn's army back as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mikael's navy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hate you all. We either face him in his home, in his terrain, with his guards everywhere, with people we cannot trust everywhere, or we lure him out and we bring him somewhere where we know the terrain, where we have places to hide, where we are prepared for him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She nods and leans forward, putting one hand over the other and her elbows on the edge of her knees on her chair. "And what makes you think a creature of such power and intelligence would ever "leave such an advantageous position to be vulnerable?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To kill us. We are the bait, and we are also the dragon killer. So he will come here to kill us, or to at least investigate our whereabouts, we hope, and when he arrives, we'll wait in ambush.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. If you're confident, you have Fort Daxio and the Aegis Regiment behind you. I "just hope you know what you're doing."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, we do. We've killed, like, a number of them and none of us have died yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not even a little bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We started with this many, and this many is still here, is what I mean.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, technically, we started the day with this many, that's for sure.

lines.name: SEVERAL
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's unconsciousness? (nervous laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see her expression drop a little bit into a curled eyebrow of confusion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Three down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's no guarantees, but this is the best bet. This is the best place for us at this point. I'm sure you understand. There are no guarantees.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you have underground facilities? Something that guards against dragon fire?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We noticed a few of the trebuchets when we walked in. How many of those do you have?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Functional? Three."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can work on that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How many non-functional?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can work on that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very not functional. Look, siege warfare hasn't been necessary for a very long time, let "alone counter-siege. Fort Daxio hasn't been under attack in close to 200 years."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It could happen. When was the last time ancient dragons took over the land?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Which is exactly why we don't have any dragon fire-protected subterranean tunnels. My "apologies, but, you know, even our budgets are limited."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we can get to work. We can get people in. We can start making this place ready and we can start making a plan. We have a lot of power and a lot of energy at our disposal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it's a montage waiting to happen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How soon do you imagine this to transpire?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The montage?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, we can get started right now!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Wait, wait, wait, wait."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (singing) Going to build some tunnels, make them look real cool!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It will take us a few days, if not weeks, to summon all of our allies here, and we'll need to get your forces ready as well. Is this something that you can fully support? Would you rather fight bravely against a dragon than die a slow starvation death?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We exist here as protectors of Emon and the Council of Tal'dorei. With the current state of "things, what's left of those things we choose and have given ourselves to protect, if we can we "will. So yes."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, step one is food, then.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, resources and food.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it here? Just creating farmland all over the world.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say it's midday.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need some source of water, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have one pitcher of water whenever we need it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, baby!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, they might already have a well here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, like a well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it still rains here, and it has watershed elements that come through the Othendin Pass from the Cliffkeep Mountains. It's the ground in this particular valley, like elements of the Cliffkeep in the north, it isn't very fertile for any sort of vegetation to take root.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's no food you can grow underground, is there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I saw this movie called The Martian. If we shit all over everything, it'll grow. Yeah, lots of potatoes grow from shit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maybe if we could make a composting system for them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So you can't grow anything right now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I get someone to take me to a courtyard, or something like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The courtyard is the area between the outer wall and the fortress itself, which is all built into the side of the mountain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do some sort of druidy soil test? pH test, or something like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: See if I can grow stuff here? With a Plant Growth spell. Just a nature check? 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15? I mean, it doesn't take too much for you to find out that the dirt here, the land itself, is very nutrient-devoid. It is a near salt and rock land, which is why a lot of it does not facilitate--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I not fix that with a Plant Growth spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you have a spell that could fix that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does Plant Growth fix that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's read the spell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have options.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For at least a day, I could create a soup kitchen. People could come in and take a bowl and leave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could they have something with veggies, too, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plant Growth affects plants that already exist, as opposed to the actual land itself.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All plants in a half-mile radius--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Isn't there something that turns the land fertile?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Poop.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's like, 5th level.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you have horses? Lots of horses?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But I mean, Scanlan, until we are ready to pull the trigger--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I mean I could create a soup kitchen, basically.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Once a day, yeah?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure. Yeah. We can have a bread line going in and out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In the meantime, Percy could take a look at some of the weaponry. Maybe look at building a tunnel, or a bunker.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: General, when's the next feeding time for your next shift of men?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So I would say four hours til dusk, that would be the next allotted mess time."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can this actually work? Can we use the spell this way?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What, the mansion? Sure, I think so. Right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a unique way of utilizing it, but I don't see why not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (phone ringing)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit! Shit balls! I can't--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We talked about this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry. I had an alarm to take off my shirt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you did?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's an anal thing. I've worn 70 different shirts on 73 episodes of the show, so if I wear four tonight, that's one for every episode.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Liam and I will give you a dunking in the bathroom after the break.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we going to double back to Dad?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, soon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have to at least send word. That's the first thing we have to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know how we send word to the Feywild without going to the Feywild.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can Plane Shift us there after we sleep and I learn it the next morning.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now that you've brought us there, do you think you could get us closer?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could take us straight there, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Percy, what do you think of looking at all this weaponry?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to look at the battalions. See if I can drudge up some people who actually know how these things function and start seeing how difficult it would be to get the ones that are broken working.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I figure out if the ground is sturdy enough if I start digging little bunkers, that would be okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bunkers for?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Underground bunkers for hiding from a flaming dragon breath.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, you could, probably. It's hard packed, very solid ground. Westruun, is where you did it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Westruun. We did the bunkers.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Didn't we do underground stuff in Whitestone, too, though?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did a bunker under the Sun Tree, kind of.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We do a lot of bunkers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, Keyleth almost has a burrowing speed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like that Fallout minigame that they came out with, the app. Basically that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we want to crack out the mansion?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, sure. I'll crack out the mansion. Where should I put it, General Elle?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm not entirely certain as to what you're attempting to do here."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry. Through magical means. We are all, not to brag, we are all super powerful. We're like a band of traveling superheroes. One of the things that I can do is make a room or a home, a magical home, where everyone can go in and get a quick meal and then go back out to work again. So with your permission and a location, I can create this magical dwelling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keeping her eyes trained on you, she leans over towards Allura. "I can't tell, is the little "man fucking with me?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He gets that a lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Allura goes, "Usually, yes, but no, he's being completely honest right now." "Then, by all means, yes."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there a spot where you would like your men to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Follow me to the mess hall." She seems legitimately spooked and unsure what to make of you, but leads you on anyway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Most women are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But yeah, you can set up in the mess hall entranceway. There is a large hall with long tables and she says that would be probably the most optimal place to go ahead and set up shop there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Question.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Legi-- logi-- (fumbling words) Logistical question. That's the word I was looking for.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stuff and things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Stuff and things. Things and stuff. They are low on meat because they're low on animals?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Most of their food was being brought by the trade routes. Since then, they've had to hunt for food and go off of whatever stock and store they had, and even that's running really low. They're hard-pressed to maintain.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Could I do a Conjure Woodland Beings and conjure a bunch of deer?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fuck yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then we could play shooting range?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do they disappear when they're dead?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, right. They disappear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's mean. No, I don't do that, by the way. I was asking ahead of time, because that would be mean. Never mind.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Also awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one druid got to level three and then opened its own hunting emporium and never became an adventurer again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Supply for days.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're checking in to see-- go ahead and make an investigation check, Taliesin, if you don't mind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ew. Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven? Asking around over the next couple hours or so, it appears that most anyone who would be a specialist in any sort of siege weaponry was part of the other regiments that are no longer part of Daxio. Even so, some of the weaponry that was here looks like it was ordered partially just to get the money in. A lot of the trebuchets that are functional are very dry-rotted and have seen many rainy winters and haven't really been kept up, and you're not even sure if they'd fire. The ones that have broken down, a lot of the wood rotted. There isn't a lot of weaponry. It looks like the three could be fixed up and be functional, but the ones that aren't, it would take you weeks with new lumber and new materials to even get them remotely functional.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right, we can make do. We can make do. I will definitely start making plans for the three that are functional to get them in tip-top working condition.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With successful tinkering checks on this, with a few borrowed hands for manpower, you could probably repair one per day of work. That's a full eight-hour day of work. So be aware of that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. How many more of them were disheveled and broken?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 12 of them.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And they each had their own spot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The three that are still semi-functional are pulled back about 60 or so feet from the edge of the walls, and then the rest of them have actually been wheeled over into the corner and have all been jammed up on the edge, unused and not to take up space.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. That'll start, at least. I'm going to look for any improvements that can be made in defensive measures against flying creatures in any way. If we use some Stone Shape, we can make this even more defendable against flying creatures, et cetera.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: General? Just because, like, I'm an inquisitive mind, what is the travel time from here to Emon on foot, on a beast? Those two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "On foot, I'd say it would put you at about five to six days. Horseback, straight through "without sleep and running the beast into the ground, you could do it in a day."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow. Cool. Good deal.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you trying to think of bringing back supplies?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I was seeing if I could run there in a night and back.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just to scout it out?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you crazy? I was just curious.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything else anyone else is looking to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess I can start on the underground bunker. For tonight, I guess.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll start on one of the-- oh god, my brain has completely turned to mush.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trebuchet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Trebuchet, thank you. I love the word.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a tinkering check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are you guys going to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That mess hall-- is there a gathering quarters for the soldiers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a barracks built into the stronghold where many of the soldiers sleep. Where there is a common area, with general tables, card games, and things to pass the time. There is a small library, with various books. You get the sense here as you begin to walk around and see the soldiers, since these guys are essentially the defensive reserve for Fort Daxio, and Daxio doesn't see a lot of military action, it's very much a train-and-wait type circumstance. And many of the soldiers, though they have grown a little gaunt in the face from lack of resources, also appear to be emotionally drained from having nothing to do. And this constant stressful uncertainty about their future fate has this air of very low morale within the fort.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: General, please don't take this the wrong way. Do you trust your men?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do. I trust their ability. I trust that they've stayed with me in the face of all this "opposition and believe that my orders and requests to stay vigilant in the face of such "possible destruction, having been met with continued agreeance that they will follow me as "needed to our end."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And there are none that you worry about, none that have expressed a lack of confidence, none that you're keeping your eye on? Giving you a weird feeling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "None that live."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like that answer. Shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oi, twinsies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oi.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe you should fly up, and if Thordak's going to attack from the air, see where the spot is that he would attack, like a spot of weakness from above?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, that's not a bad idea. We're thinking about tomorrow, though, as well. In the morning, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should pop into Syngorn.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could you take the two of us, Keyleth?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But yeah, we'll fly up. Let's do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys go ahead and coast up, to do what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To see if there's anything of use, see if there's anything to be gleaned from a bird's-eye view.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because it's on the cliffside, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, if you look at the large ravine that is carved through this portion of the mountain there. From your perspective, looking at the map down this way. It is on the western side of the ravine, against the mountain. You guys coast up, looking up. Matching the very height of the mountain, the bluff that leads down into the ravine itself, and you can see over the edge the ocean of the Ozmit Sea that heads off westward. You can see a little bit of the light as the sun comes down to a sunset. You can see it glittering across the waves in the distance. You can see the little mountain range to the north of Emon, peering over the edge. And you can see a little bit of a dark spot in the very distance, over the horizon that you can gather where Emon is. You can see it from this high up. Even though it is but a small spot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (sings) From a distance...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (shouts) What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (shouts) It looks peaceful up here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (shouts) Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are we doing? Do we see anything interesting?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not enjoying the view, I start to look down around, is there anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That seems useful, for, like, if we put something on the cliffside or something? Maybe a hideout, somewhere to hide from view, something like that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there anything we didn't see coming up? Or is it all plain to view?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys make an investigation.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Almost awesome. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys take the next hour or so coasting along the edge of the mountain range, the top of the ravine itself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it a mountain?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are, it is a mountain range and the ravine itself carves through a portion of it, so the right and left side, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: At the 59 minute mark I fly over and sit on the back of my sister's broom

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it favored terrain?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is your favored terrain mountains?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then yeah, you get advantage on that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's good for somebody who's expecting an incursion from flying creatures. It'd be a great place to put a scout, as a warning system, should anything begin to make its way towards the fort from Emon or beyond. There are places where you could in theory drop things down the edges of the mountain that would use the ravine almost like a bowling alley, essentially, large boulders and rocks. Which is a favored tactic of many stone giants and other giants who use mountain terrain to their advantage. But beyond that, there's no other terrain that you think would, outside of you coming up with a creative use of it, there's nothing that is glaring to you as an advantage in the coming fray.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could put somebody in a hidey-hole up here. And if they see anything, they drop a stone down to a designated area and let people know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. They could throw out one of those flare-like gem-y thingies. Ring a bell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh yeah! We have those. A bell is probably the best idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Any of those. You want to take us down? This broom always rides up my ass when I ride on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, because your little wings are dead?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, they are.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. I'll float us down on my ever-flying broom.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ow!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you guys descend.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I go down pretty slow to make this last a little bit longer.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Getting close though, yeah?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To take out all of this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kill 'em, or die trying.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys, make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that was so close to a one, but it wasn't! 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 22, okay. As you guys come down--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, wait, no! 26! My math was wrong.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. As you guys come down into the bottom of the ravine you make it down safely into Fort Daxio to gather with the rest of your compadres for the evening. You at this point, by the way, Scanlan. You are currently, because you have to be present to designate anybody who can enter your mansion. You are like the one-person homeless shelter. You are bringing through soldier after soldier into there. And they all look confused, bewildered. And many of them stop and be like, "What's going on?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Name on the list? What's your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (stuttering) "I am--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (stuttering) "Are you--? What is--?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Listen, man. Do you want some food or not? What's your name? I've got a big list here, there's no girl with you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Trevian Simtin. Please, I'm hungry."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you have a plus one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have a plus?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're in."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right!" One after another, after another. Some of them seem genuinely spooked and freaked out by the spiritual servants, and avoiding them as they go on. The smell of food hits them, though. The ever-smell of chicken cooking through does catch them. And they all seem to eventually get past their fear of the servants as the fantastic meal of relatively neutral flesh is served to them in your dining hall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's still no veggies, huh? They could probably use some vegetable nutrition.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sure they boil the chicken in like an onion sort of water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do they? Or is it like a chicken broth that they boil them in?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They have the fusaka now. They put a little bit of that in. Spices it up a bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Keyleth. Explain the bunker you're building for me, if you could.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Should I do it on the inside? In the courtyard, make an underground pod. Think Fallout.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. Is it closer to the wall, or closer to the actual fortress itself, the entrance that leads to the underground pathway?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I imagine closer to the fortress, right? On the inside.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Deep in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And then mirrors the curvature of the wall? Or does it travel perpendicular to it and go underneath the wall?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I imagine we wouldn't want to go underneath the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're essentially building it in the same curvature parallel to the outer wall.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you build this bunker, you take the better part of the evening, and probably the next morning or so to complete whatever the spell's maximum effort is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is less about your intellect or your manual dexterity, this is about tools and having to apply it. You do have advantage because you have other men helping you with this. But the DC is relatively high.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll do. 25.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25, okay. While the rest of you are finishing up your events of the evening and preparing to go to sleep, Percy is working tirelessly into the wee hours of the morning. You finish, probably like two hours after midnight, with the rest of your crew sore, sweaty. But you have one functional trebuchet that looks like it could handle many, many shots within one battle and still be serviceable.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shirtless, covered in soot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He wipes his brow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he slowly takes his glasses off--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Takes the water skin and just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All the soldiers are like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Percy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Spells restored. Hit points restored. Allura comes in and greets all of you. "All right, so! I can "also bring us back to Whitestone. I've restored the teleportation spell that I had. Thus, what do "you wish to do now?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Number one. (whispers) Never say "Whitestone" in public, ever.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Around us, especially. We could still do work here. Here's what has to happen now. We need to send word to as many people as possible that we are meeting here for the final confrontation. We have to make sure that work continues here. And then, if there's time, while our forces assemble and things prepare, we have several things we can do in the meantime.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right. Keyleth is necessary to get to the Feywild.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or Allura.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Could I theoretically open a tree and send people in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To the Feywild? But how would we get back?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, not to the Feywild. If we need to see someone to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whitestone?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, or Marquet. Or wherever.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have the stone, as well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So it's going to be Keyleth and one of the twinsies go to the Feywild, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you do any plane shifting things, Pikey Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't have it prepared.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't have it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't have it prepared.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, there is that fire elemental plane with the last Vestige, eh?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could. That is absolutely on the table.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Could we? Do we have time for that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to take us a week to get this place even remotely ready for this confrontation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Allura at this point, by the way, says, "A week? I don't know if we have a week."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What happens in less than a week?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The minute that the information of Vorugal's death finds its way to Thordak, what do "you think is going to happen? Their vengeance is going to fall."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to take a few days for that to happen, to be set in motion.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you kidding? I don't know. It could be any minute now. They've been spying on us this whole time. What makes you think it will take a few days?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Also, throwing it out there. If you guys go to the Feywild, isn't there a chance that you don't come back until a month later or something crazy like that? Doesn't time shift weirdly?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an intelligence check. Add your intelligence modifier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18. And you could technically add--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You added your d12 to it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, no, not my d12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could use one of your bardic inspirations to inspire yourself, if you wanted to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, why not? I'll do that. All right, 22 then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Having journeyed once to the Feywild, and with the little bit of research you've done since then. There have been people who have been to the Feywild who do speak of some sort of temporal anomaly when traveling to and from. So yes, you are certain that there can be some sort of flexibility as to the time spent there versus the time that has transpired in the Prime Material plane. Not a sure thing, but there is some variation to that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's life without a little risk?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They can transfer back when they want to.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's see what we can do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They have a huge army.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And they've got werewolves in their woods.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know how we'll be able to get word to them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You howl.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Allura sneaks in a bit and says, "My only suggestion here is make sure that you do the "things that are absolutely necessary for

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we have to get armies here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then let's do it."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's what we're trying to do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, wait. Don't we need to send word to other places as well? How do we do that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I don't know how to reach my herd.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Isn't there a big horn you blow or something?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, they wander to and fro.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You could find them, probably?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They were wandering somewhere specific, though. Into the riverlands or something?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can scry and find out where they are and then send someone as mist-form you, or something, and go catch up with them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll spread the fuck out and then Thordak will attack and then none of us will be here!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stop rolling, that's really disconcerting when you sit there and roll at us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which we have no reason to believe that he cares to come find us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Quick list, people. Quick list! Who do we need to contact, Slayer's Take?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: -Ish. Yeah. Bottom of the list, because I don't think they would--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ravenites?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Syngorn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Syngorn. That's a big one. That's a biggie right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And that's a biggie because it's also got these soldiers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The wolf pack?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Also there. We can howl.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Herd.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Herd.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Platinum Dragon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bahamut?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: J'mon Sa Ord, sort of? -Ish?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We've got that thing--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we've got that whistle. What about Bahamut's people in Vasselheim?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the Platinum Sanctuary.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, what about the Platinum Sanctuary?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what I'm saying.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I thought you were talking about--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no. I said the word "platinum." I was there. And you robbed me of it. I did it right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry, Grog. You're so smart!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there anyone else who's pledged their allegiance to us? Any other band of traveling idiots?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could ask for help from Kraghammer, as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it's so close.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could ask, potentially, my father and the Air Ashari. I'd have a hard time asking the Fire Ashari, there's so few of them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Didn't the werewolves want to leave the Feywild, right? They wanted

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think so. I don't know. I think they just wanted out of those woods, but-- Maybe we could find Artagan while we're there. Maybe he could pop over and we'll have an archfey helping us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We also have a 2,000 person capacity here. I mean, we can always push it and make encampments on the outside, but what's our ideal number we're trying to hit?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A jillion. As many as we can.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It feels like it's a risk, but the most bang for our buck, our gold piece, is Syngorn. There's the most people there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And as far as we remember, the people of Vasselheim. Their general temperament is Vasselheim takes care of Vasselheim.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's what it felt like when we were there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vasselheim and the continuation of civilization, and that being the Dawn Cradle, the city that's existed for as long as civilization has, is to be protected at all costs. So while they do and can offer aid occasionally outside of it, not to the detriment of their own defense.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that it? Is that everyone?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We could go talk to that Earthbreaker Groon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where is he?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vasselheim. This is a lot of different places in like a day and a half.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could write an awful lot of letters.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. And hopefully they'll show up like Game of Thrones at the last moment. We'll think we're overrun, and then all of a sudden another army shows up, and it's wonderful!

lines.name: MARISHA
